story:
Who Are We?

We are The Trick 'R Treaters, a professional performance troupe based out of York, Pennsylvania.  We formed out of a desire to bring something new and unique to our community.  Our mission is to create high quality entertainment experiences that inspire and spark creativity in those around us while creating a feasible way for local artists to create a livelihood from their skills in the arts.  We do not believe that you should have to live in an overcrowded and overpriced area like New York City or Los Angeles to make a living as an artist, nor should you have to be part of a union in order to obtain respect and a decent wage.  We will be creating a campaign for each theatrical project as one of several ways to offer you, our supporters, a chance to help us create these masterpieces.  It literally takes a community to put on a successful production of any size.  Our first production, Bite Size: An Evening Of Miniature Theatre, was an extraordinary experience.  We hope to bring you many more of these gems, starting with "The Ledge".

 

What We Need To Succeed:

This particular production will cost us approximately $675.00.  This money will cover...

*the cost of our rehearsal space

*full costumes and makeup for our performers

*props to make the piece more realistic

*a base salary for the artists (both cast and crew) involved in this production

Individuals who contribute to this production will be listed in our program as a special sponsor of this show.  Local contributors will be invited to a special behind-the-scenes experience where you get to see all of our hard work up close and see the show before anyone else!  For our supporters who are not local, you will receive a DVD copy of the filmed performance.  We are leaving this as a flexible campaign, because every penny raised helps with our costs.  If we go over our goal, the extra money will go towards our second project in the works called "The Reckoning".

 

The Impact Of This Production

The arts give us a chance to explore the deepest parts of the human experience.  According to the Anxiety And Depression Association Of America, approximately 40 million adults in the United States suffer from anxiety in one form or another.  That's a lot.  This piece explores this rampant yet taboo topic in a way that we feel will touch our audiences.  Anxiety is a disorder that leads to bizarre behaviors.  We hope to entertain you while shedding some light on this pretty common ailment and the stress it causes the sufferer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that not all of you are in a position to financially contribute to this particular production.  But don't worry, you can help us too!  Simply share our campaign all over your social media accounts.  Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, whatever you've got.  Just remember to tell your friends and fans why our mission is important to you so they know WHY it is important for them to care about us and our cause.

Also, if you have a business or know of a business who would like to get the word out, we are offering 3 advertisement spots in our programs for this show.  Please have any interested parties email us at albarosacats@gmail.com and put "The Ledge Advertiser" in the subject line.

story:
Verkörperung

Verkörperung (German noun for embodiment) is a double bill featuring two works:Tracey Norman's where we intersect and Angela Blumberg's solo Self-Portrait. A DanceWorks CoWorks event, the production takes place at The Citadel: Ross Centre for Dance from April 29th - May 2nd, 2020.

Angela's solo Self-Portrait takes inventory of a life that includes loss, hope and new beginnings. Whether physically or psychologically, choices we’ve made unconsciously have consequences that suddenly show up in our lives like uninvited guests. How do you host them? Self-Portrait is a multi-media solo combining video, spoken word and dance. The different media are used to capture the self and to delve into the complex, fractured system that the self is. 

Tracey's piece where we intersect is a series of shorts - solos, duets and trios- connected into a larger work delving into the failure and recovery of the body. This collaborative work delves into the failure and recovery of the body, laying bare the stories of the body and its miraculous abilities to heal and connect. where we intersect explores the act of listening to the body. There is the listening to one’s own body and the listening we do while attending to those with whom we share space. The structure of the dance allows Tracey to engage with 6 profoundly compelling and diverse dance artists: Irvin Chow, Justine Comfort, Jesse Dell,  Rufi Oswaldo, Julia Sasso and Denise Solleza.

Donations 

Although both our works received generous funding for their creation, we find ourselves short of funding for the production despite having applied for government funding numerous times. Donations will go towards covering our productions costs including performers' salaries, our lighting designer and stage manager and theatre rental.

Impact

By supporting our production you support the independent dance community in Toronto including professional dancers and choreographers, technical personnel, and venues that specialize in featuring work of independent choreographers. Both Angela and Tracey are at a point in their career where  transitioning from emerging to mid career artist takes place. Like most transitions this requires some form of re-orientation. Funding that supports grass root projects is no longer available and funding that supports established companies is not available yet. It is a time where we're figuring out how to proceed and implement new structures that allow us to continue to create work going forward. Your donation will help us transition and contribute to the presentation of works by mid-career artists.

 

Show Info

Verkörperung 

April 29-May 2, 2020  / The Citadel: Ross Centre for Dance / 304 Parliament St (at Dundas)

www.angelablumbergdance.com / www.traceynorman.com

story:
Why are we here?

This campaign represents the intake of a new breath for Fearless as a company. We are entering the third season of our "Defiance" story arc and our sixth season as a company. You are invited to come alongside us in this exciting new chapter.

As we introduce new members of our Executive Company, Fearless finds itself at a pivotal point - a point of growth. We continue striving to be a safe space for actors and creatives, a space free of judgement and harassment, all while producing challenging and timely art for audiences across the Denver Area. In order to provide these excellent experiences, we have crafted an engaging season for our audiences. This is the season of light in the darkness, of love, our season of "Hope".

 

Fearless remains committed to creating art with a message. We create and share art with heart. Join us as we share "Hope". We tell stories. We tell our story. We share your story. 

Be Fearless,

The Fearless Executive Company

#befearless

story:
Inspirited with the tradition of Umbanda ritual, the music of Gloria Estefan, Cher, and Maria Bethânia, NI MI MADRE invites the audience into the tumultuous relationship between Bete (a larger-than-life Brazilian woman who swears that if it weren’t for Madonna, Meryl Streep, and Angelina Jolie she would have been the “It” thing) and her queer son. As she grapples with the secrets that tear her and her son apart, the unbidden memories of her estranged mother, and the lineage that binds them all together she unveils to us, her confidants, her judges, her audience, the downfalls of American parenting.

 

Written and Performed by Arturo Luís Soria

Directed by Danilo Gambini

Produced by Leandro A. Zaneti

Set Design by Stephanie O. Cohen

Costume Design by Mika Eubanks

Lighting Design by Krista Smith

Sound Design by Kathy Ruvuna

Stage Manager: Fabiola Feliciano-Batista 

 

NI MI MADRE

Arturo began working on NI MI MADRE ten years ago in a college solo performance class. The play began as an improvised performance based on the stories Arturo remembered from his childhood and his actual journals from different points in his life. The play began as a way for Arturo to deal with his identity, and his relationship to his mother and grandmother. Over the past decade, Arturo has continued to refine and shape the beautiful narrative that exists as NI MI MADRE today.  In 2018, the first full production of NI MI MADRE, directed by Danilo Gambini, premiered at the Yale Cabaret to rave reviews.

 

The creative team is thrilled to be bringing NI MI MADRE to Rave Theater Festival. We want the play to continue to move people and inspire them to call their mothers, or grandmothers, or mother figures and to ask them about their unique journeys. NI MI MADRE is a ritual of forgiveness, and lineage, and history. It is for your mother, and her mother, and her mother before…

 

Rave Theater Festival is a huge opportunity for Arturo, Danilo, and our entire creative team. The festival, produced by Ken Davenport, provides a platform for the show and an opportunity for us to connect with presenters, producers, and other artists. We are excited to showcase the work of the phenomenal team we’ve put together and to share the beauty of this story with a wider community.

 

But, as our mothers used to say, no opportunities in life come for free. 

So… we are raising $5,000 for NI MI MADRE this summer! We would love your support.

 

This amount will cover the costs of participating in the festival, paying our artists for their work, production materials and marketing. The full breakdown is as follows:

 

$1,800 for paying our artists. We believe in paying every collaborator because we need every one of us to create the vision. By supporting NI MI MADRE, you are supporting directly supporting the diverse group of artists we’ve established for this project.

 

$1,200 for festival fees. Being selected for the festival doesn’t come for free! This amount will cover our festival fees, as well as additional fees to set NI MI MADRE up for a future life!

 

$650 for travel. Our director and our stage manager are both travelling in from New Haven for each performance. This amount covers their MetroNorth tickets and the rental for a car to transport materials to the venue.

 

$600 for production materials.

 

$500 for Marketing. We want EVERYONE to see this play.

 

$250 for General Company Expenses, including volunteer accident insurance. 

 

If you aren't able to support us financially, please help us spread the word about the show! Please tell your friends and family and share on social media. If you have any further ways you would be interested in supporting NI MI MADRE, please contact our Producer, Leandro Zaneti at NiMiMadrePlay@gmail.com
story_txt:
Inspirited with the tradition of Umbanda ritual, the music of Gloria Estefan, Cher, and Maria Bethânia, NI MI MADRE invites the audience into the tumultuous relationship between Bete (a larger-than-life Brazilian woman who swears that if it weren’t for Madonna, Meryl Streep, and Angelina Jolie she would have been the “It” thing) and her queer son. As she grapples with the secrets that tear her and her son apart, the unbidden memories of her estranged mother, and the lineage that binds them all together she unveils to us, her confidants, her judges, her audience, the downfalls of American parenting.
 
Written and Performed by Arturo Luís Soria
Directed by Danilo Gambini
Produced by Leandro A. Zaneti
Set Design by Stephanie O. Cohen
Costume Design by Mika Eubanks
Lighting Design by Krista Smith
Sound Design by Kathy Ruvuna
Stage Manager: Fabiola Feliciano-Batista 
 
NI MI MADRE
Arturo began working on NI MI MADRE ten years ago in a college solo performance class. The play began as an improvised performance based on the stories Arturo remembered from his childhood and his actual journals from different points in his life. The play began as a way for Arturo to deal with his identity, and his relationship to his mother and grandmother. Over the past decade, Arturo has continued to refine and shape the beautiful narrative that exists as NI MI MADRE today.  In 2018, the first full production of NI MI MADRE, directed by Danilo Gambini, premiered at the Yale Cabaret to rave reviews.
 
The creative team is thrilled to be bringing NI MI MADRE to Rave Theater Festival. We want the play to continue to move people and inspire them to call their mothers, or grandmothers, or mother figures and to ask them about their unique journeys. NI MI MADRE is a ritual of forgiveness, and lineage, and history. It is for your mother, and her mother, and her mother before…
